parts:
Please see the attached project files for a tuition website.

I have a Formspree account. By taking reference to the following template code provided by Formspree, create a form for my websiite similar to the attached image, but use the color, font, and design scheme provided by the attached CSS file.

```html
<!-- modify this form HTML and place wherever you want your form -->
<form
  action="https://formspree.io/f/xnnbdawp"
  method="POST"
>
  <label>
    Your email:
    <input type="email" name="email">
  </label>
  <label>
    Your message:
    <textarea name="message"></textarea>
  </label>
  <!-- your other form fields go here -->
  <button type="submit">Send</button>
</form>
```

**Crafting a form**

I'm mapping out a form using Formspree and corporate-1.9.6.css, ensuring it aligns with the website's design tokens and includes necessary accessibility features.

**Integrating contact forms**

I’m pulling together the contact form into `tuition-website-v5.html` using Formspree, ensuring poper layout, accessibility, and mobile responsiveness with minimal JavaScript.

**Choosing submission models**

I'm weighing Fetch-based submission for progressive enhancement versus traditional HTML submission. The Fetch approach needs CORS and script, while fallback is straightforward.

**Stylizing the layout**

Optimizing the form's aesthetic involves using site tokens, adding accessibility features, and preventing spam with a hidden field. This ensures a polished and user-friendly design.

**Finalizing integration**

I’m detailing the final HTML, CSS, and optional JavaScript for seamless integration. This includes accessibility features, design tokens, and a spam reduction strategy.

**Finalizing the design**

I'm wrapping up the CSS for the contact section, ensuring it matches the site style and is accessible. This includes details on layout, spacing, validation, and JavaScript enhancements for a polished user experience.

**Finalizing the response**

I'm laying out HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, ensuring seamless integration. This involves adding disclaimers and citations, while also mentioning how to efficiently format these sections for clarity.

For the contact information card on the left, change the background the very dark brown for dark mode, and very light brown for light mode.  The background colour in this card has to be chosen such that it provides excellent contrast with the text and hyperlinks.

Make the font sizes bigger too. 

The "Contact" title should follow the same large size as the titles of the other sections, and make it centralized.

When the "other" radio button is clicked, the "If other, please specify" field should become usable -- right now, it remain unusable. 

For the telephone number, first scan if it begins with "+65 ". If not, automatically add in "+65 " at the beginning. If it begins with a "+" but the country code is not "65", for instance, it begins with "+66", alert with error message "Only Singapore numbers allowed".

For the contact information card on the left, change the background the very dark brown for light mode.  The background colour in this card has to be chosen such that it provides excellent contrast with the text and hyperlinks.

Make the font sizes bigger too. 

The "Contact" title should follow the same large size as the titles of the other sections, and make it centralized.

When the "other" radio button is clicked, the "If other, please specify" field should become usable -- right now, it remain unusable. 

For the telephone number, first scan if it begins with "+65 ". If not, automatically add in "+65 " at the beginning. If it begins with a "+" but the country code is not "65", for instance, it begins with "+66", alert with error message "Only Singapore numbers allowed".

For the contact information card on the left, change the background the very dark brown for all modes.  The background colour in this card has to be chosen such that it provides excellent contrast with the text and hyperlinks.

Make the font sizes bigger too. 

The "Contact" title should follow the same large size as the titles of the other sections, and make it centralized.

When the "other" radio button is clicked, the "If other, please specify" field should become usable -- right now, it remain unusable. 

For the telephone number, first scan if it begins with "+65 ". If not, automatically add in "+65 " at the beginning. If it begins with a "+" but the country code is not "65", for instance, it begins with "+66", alert with error message "Only Singapore numbers allowed".

**Enhancing contact card**

I'll set theme-aware variables for contact cards, ensuring contrasting colors and adjusting font sizes for better readability.

**Addressing user requests**

I’m ensuring the contact info card background is dark brown, font sizes are increased, and the "Other" toggle works. Also, adding automatic prefixing to phone numbers.

**Enhancing contact section**

I’m tweaking the "Contact" title for larger font and centering. The contact card's background is updated to a dark brown (#3b2416) with white text for accessibility.

**Enhancing accessibility**

I’m working on font sizes and color contrasts to improve consistency and accessibility. Updates to CSS ensure better visibility and alignment.

**Settling on font choices**

I’m aligning the contact section title font with the "split" style to ensure consistency across all web pages. This leads me to harmonize design elements for a unified look.

**Finalizing implementation**

I’m noting the final changes: updating the CSS for better contrast, enhancing font sizes, centralizing titles, and refining phone number validation. Modifications will be added to the HTML and JavaScript.

**Ensuring accessibility**

I'm making phone number validation more robust, enhancing spacing and font sizes for readability, and improving hyperlink contrast for accessibility.

**Updating and refining**

I’m enhancing the CSS with a dark brown contact card, larger typography, and centralized titles. Addressing phone number validation, I’m also ensuring all previous major styles are maintained.

**Compiling final updates**

I’m preparing the final code blocks, including the CSS override, HTML snippet for the phone input, and the complete script replacement.

For the javascript, I would like the page to load the intended Formspree page upon form submission, because the Formspree page contains a reCATCHPA challenge to deter spammers, and the Formspree page also allows the user to gracefully return to the original page without fuss.

**Implementing form enhancements**

I’m working on adjusting the form submission method, normalizing phone numbers, enabling "Other" fields, and ensuring valid submissions by removing AJAX and using a 'submit' event listener.

**Refining form validation**

I'm pulling together a new JS code snippet, ensuring phone normalization, and addressing "Other" field enabling. Maintaining "normalize leading +65" aligns with previous validation logic.

**Refining the script**

I’m detailing the updated JS snippet, including removal of AJAX, enabling "Other" field toggling, ensuring valid phone numbers, and providing minimal patch instructions for clarity.

**Crafting the script**

I’m detailing a new JS snippet with variables, character counter, "Other" toggle, and phone rules. I’ll ensure valid phone numbers and include necessary citations for precision.
which CSS parameter determines the hyperlink and its hover colour for light mode?

In the left "Contact Information" card, for light mode, make the hyperlink and its hover the same colours as in dark mode. Also, for the form on the right, in light mode, make the black border of the "Send Message" pill thicker, and for dark mode, also create a white border in a similar fashion for this pill.

**Tweaking link colors**

I'm setting the hyperlink and hover colors in light mode to match dark mode. Using a CSS patch to unify the styles across themes.

**Aligning styles**

I'm noting adjustments to ensure hyperlinks in light mode match dark mode. Also enhancing specificity to prevent base styles from overriding, aiming for a consistent visual outcome across themes.

**Crafting a final touch**

OK, let me see. I’m creating a concise CSS patch to unify light and dark mode styles, ensuring no underlying tokens are swapped. This involves tweaks to hyperlink colors and button borders.

About The Tutor

Greetings! This is Dr Ng, a dedicated private tutor in Singapore, specializing in Mathematics for Junior College and Upper Secondary, as well as Mathematics and Statistics at the University level.

I strive to create a learning environment that is both enjoyable and enriching, ensuring that every student has a fulfilling educational experience.

More than 80 percent of my students have seen at least a two grade improvement after just a few months of tuition. Many have achieved distinctions in their final examinations.

Academic Qualifications

  • Ph.D (Mathematics) from National University of Singapore
  • B.Sc. (Honours - First Class) from National University of Singapore

Experience

  • Full time tutor since 2010
  • Both tuition centre and home-based
  • Well-versed with latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus

Various Levels Taught

University Maths

Mathematics at University and Polytechnic level is extremely broad in scope. I cover Probability & Statistics, Calculus of Several Variables, Linear Algebra, Analysis, Abstract Algebra, and Discrete Mathematics for Year 1 and 2.

WhatsApp Me Now

Junior College Maths

Junior College (JC) Mathematics is where I have the most extensive experience. I provide focused tracks for H1 Mathematics, H2 Mathematics, H3 Mathematics, and H2 Further Mathematics -- all latest MOE syllabus.

WhatsApp Me Now

Secondary Level

I tutor both Elementary Maths and Additional Maths for G3 and G2 students (latest MOE syllabus) and also provide coverage for Integrated Programme (IP).

WhatsApp Me Now

thoughts.summary: Identifying hover color in light mode
thoughts.content: The CSS parameters that define the hyperlink and its hover color for light mode are found in the provided section. Specifically, `color: #0b5bd3;` sets the regular hyperlink color, while `color: #c00000;` is used for the hover/active state. These are hardcoded hex values, rather than CSS variables.

The CSS selectors controlling anchor colors for light mode are:  
`:root[data-theme="light"] #main-content .section a { color: #0b5bd3; }` for regular hyperlinks, and `:root[data-theme="light"] #main-content .section a:hover { color: #c00000; }` for hover states. There are no specific variables used here—just hardcoded hex values for light mode's link colors.

thoughts.summary: Answering about CSS hyperlink color with citations
thoughts.content:
The hyperlink color in light mode is controlled by the `color` property in the CSS selectors. For reference, the specific lines are cited as follows:  
- CSS file: [filecite turn0file2].

The file search tool doesn’t include line numbers in its output, just full snippets. The instructions say I need line numbers for citations, but earlier I used the filecite format without them, and it seemed to work fine. I’ll need to figure out whether to include line numbers manually or use range estimates.

parts:
Short answer: it’s not a token—your light-mode link colors are hard-coded with the `color` property in these rules:

```css
:root[data-theme="light"] #main-content .section a { color: #0b5bd3; }      /* link */
:root[data-theme="light"] #main-content .section a:hover,
:root[data-theme="light"] #main-content .section a:focus-visible { color: #c00000; }  /* hover/focus */
```
fileciteturn0file2

Notes:
- The **hero** section is separate: it uses `--hero-link` and `--hero-link-hover` variables inside `.hero-bullets a`, so changes above won’t affect links over the hero image. fileciteturn0file2
- These rules apply to links within `#main-content .section …`; that’s the wrapper used in your HTML. fileciteturn0file1

If you want to tune only the contact card in light mode, scope an override like:
```css
:root[data-theme="light"] #contact a { color: /* your color */; }
:root[data-theme="light"] #contact a:hover,
:root[data-theme="light"] #contact a:focus-visible { color: /* your hover */; }
```
